means: 对（某人）发号施令( boss的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: No one likes being bossed or dictated to, let alone defeated.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人愿意被管束或被命令, 更不用说被击败了.

sentence.Network_en: She's bossed and nagged him ever since they got married.
sentence.Network_cn: 自从他们结婚以来,她老是对他发号施令,跟他纠缠不休.

sentence.Network_en: The surface of the gangplank was bossed to prevent slipping.
sentence.Network_cn: 跳板的表面被装上凸出物以防止滑动.

entry.def: Your boss is the person in charge of the organization or department where you work.

example.ex: Occasionally I have to go and ask the boss for a rise.
example.tran: 有时我不得不找老板要求加薪。

entry.def: If you are the boss in a group or relationship, you are the person who makes all the decisions.

entry.tran: 对…颐指气使；对…指手画脚
entry.def: If you say that someone bosses you, you mean that they keep telling you what to do in a way that is irritating.

example.ex: We cannot boss them into doing more...
example.tran: 我们不能再差遣他们做更多的事了。

example.ex: 'You are not to boss me!' she shouted.

entry.tran: 为自己打工；自己拿主意
entry.def: If you are your own boss, you work for yourself or make your own decisions and do not have anyone telling you what to do.

example.ex: I'm very much my own boss and no one interferes with what I do.
example.tran: 我自己很有主见，没有人干预我做的事。

auth_sentence.content: He wanted to be adored and elevated, not bossed.
auth_sentence.res_content: He wanted to be adored and elevated, not bossed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He wanted to be adored and elevated, not bossed.

auth_sentence.content: Northampton bossed the early exchanges and their pack soon had Wasps in reverse.
auth_sentence.res_content: Northampton bossed the early exchanges and their pack soon had Wasps in reverse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Northampton bossed the early exchanges and their pack soon had Wasps in reverse.

auth_sentence.content: James's was a hell of an effort to come back, then Dan came in and he bossed that match.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: James's was a hell of an effort to come back, then Dan came in and he bossed that match.
